column1: full and floated wide outside off. Slight bend inwards. Guptill has the stride to reach and tap this wide of mid-off
good length and slow movement away from the corridor. Tapped into the off side with soft hands to steal the single
drifting in at the pads from back of a length. Guptill stands tall and allows it to come on, before dabbing it to short fine's right and beating his dive
good length on off stump, angling into the batsman. Defended down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
good length and wide outside off. Doesn's swing back enough to make him play
good length and in at off stump. A nice, confident stride to get beside the line and push to mid-off
length and slanted across off stump, comes on nicely as he punches through the line on the up. Can't beat mid-off to his right
short of a length on middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot

is that an edge? Yes it is! Munro has wafted away from the body and there's a feather on this. Not too much movement, only slight wobble as this is angled across him. He hasn't covered for the width or the bounce. It's a straighforward take for Buttler
short and wide outside off, left alone
slashes away from the body and he's beaten. Overpitched ball outside off and he's a little late on the attempted drive
beaten again. Feet rooted in the crease as he looks to drive through the off side as this angles away
good length with shape in at leg stump. Pushed through the open square leg region
length on off stump, nudged through square leg with a watchful push. That pinged off the inside half of the bat
back of a length and thudding into the thigh guard with the shape inwards. He was looking to glance
good length, into the pads, flicked straight to short fine
some more swing inwards, but this starts on leg stump and goes further down
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot. Via the inside edge.
good length on leg stump, solidly defended on the front foot
length on off stump and some climb off the surface as Chapman looks to defend on the front foot. Gets it into the off side off the high part of the outside half

Willey runs back from midwicket and takes it with a slide on his knees. Chapman late on yet another shot against Woakes, but this time he'll pay because he's trapped on a middle stump line, trying to pull. Back of a length ball, with some extra climb again and he's caught halfway in his swivel as he goes for the shot. It's good work from the fielder, who had to go about ten yards back and to his right before reaching out and completing it
good length and swinging away late from off stump. Watchfully defended on the front foot
full on middle and off. Doesn't get the shape away this time and Guptill squeezes this through midwicket off the inside half
good length and angled in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
good length outside off, nice forward stride to drive on the up to mid-off
full and swung in at middle stump. Hurriedly tapped to mid-on
length and in at leg stump. Flicked to deep square leg
good length and slanted across the corridor, left alone
full and swung in at middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
good length on off stump, tapped on the up to cover's left. He won't let that through - puts in a dive to stop it clean
good length on middle stump, defended towards the bowler on the front foot
full outside off and he looks to drive with hard hands. It trickles wide of mid-on off the inside half
short of a length and swinging away outside off. Left alone
good length and just outside off. Left alone
good length just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
caresses this wide of mid-off to find the boundary. Length ball outside off and the feet haven't moved too much but he's playing close to the body. Extends the arms and keeps full control
compensates with an overpitched ball on leg stump. Hangs deep in the crease, gets the pad in front of the pad and clips it to the wide long-on boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
good length and pushed across middle stump. Closes the face early on this and gets a leading edge towards point
good length on middle stump, tapped to short midwicket
struck on the thigh as he misses on the flick. Willey lot less fuller this over. Gets this to skid in from short of a length
full and in at leg stump, poked into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to third man off the thick outside edge
marginally short from Woakes and Taylor pounces. Slices this and it skids rapidly across the turf. Moeen Ali puts in a heroic dive to his right at third man and keeps it in
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, defended to point on the up

lifts it over the bowler and wide of mid-on. A classy, balanced shot from Guptill. The gold standard for straight hitting right now, this guy. Leans in slightly against this length ball on middle and lifts it neatly with the full power of his reach
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off. Left alone

creamed. This is very organised stuff from Guptill so far. Length outside off and he plonks the front leg across before driving through the line. Once again, he sticks with the V. Gets it wide of mid-off
good length outside off, tapped into the off side with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
tossed up on middle stump, steps out and flicks to long-on
good length on off stump, tapped back to the bowler on the front foot
floated up at middle stump. Yorks himself
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
tossed up on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length on middle stump, flicked against the turn, straight to midwicket
length on middle stump, tapped into the vacant square leg region
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, puts in a stride and uses his wrists to get this into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, tapped to point's right with soft hands
back of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
length on off stump, clipped to fine leg's left with a hope. A confident call allows him to finish a tight second run
good length on off stump, driven on the up to long-off
good length outside off, dead-batted into the off side on the front foot
googly. Zips back in off the surface and climbs at Taylor who is still backing away as it passes his cut on the outside edge
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on off stump. Steps out and he's not close to getting to the pitch. Pushed on the up towards midwicket
length on middle stump, can't beat midwicket with the flick
length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
length and angled in at leg stump. Nudged through square leg with a bat-pad
length on middle stump, clipped to deep square
full on leg stump, tapped to mid-on on the up
he continues to pick Curran into the leg side from wide outside off. This time it's a check-drive, wide of mid-on. Woakes doesn't let it pass to his right
length outside off, tapped through the covers on the up
good length, off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
top edge falls short of long leg. The mistake was coming. Rashid has them squeezed at the moment. It's a length ball on middle stump. Premeditated half-sweep form Guptill lands short

it looks like Willey has pulled off another sensational piece of fielding. Taylor won't wait for the third umpire's decision on this run out. This is epic stuff from Willey at backward point. Rashid drops short and Taylor slaps it. It's a release shot after a long time and this probably leads to him instinctively take off for a run. But Willey has leapt to his right to stop this with one hand, close to the ground. He's then chucked it back in with force after swivelling to switch to his stronger hand and it's close enough to the stumps that Buttler won't have difficulty whipping the bails off. Guptill sends Taylor back, and Taylor's dive can't get him anywhere close
plenty of flight on that, outside off, pushed in front of point
back of a length from Curran, 135 kph, pushed to cover. Guptill will now have to recalibrate.

terrific bouncer, 134 kph, it's not too high, it's not aimed at the head, which is why Guptill takes it a tad easy. And then he realises that this is a good ball, so he sways out of the line very late
poor delivery there, short and down leg, Guptill just helps it along to the fine leg fence without any hassle. No fine leg. Mis-directed from Curran
good comeback, on a length, seaming back in, Guptill gets behind the line to defend
131 kph, on a length and straight, defended back
good length delivery, 132 kph, pushed in front of point for a run. A good single
another dot, plenty of flight around middle, skewed off the leading edge towards cover
82 kph, overly full around middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, driven back towards the bowler
cuts that away for four. Short and wide this time from Rashid, Guptill goes back and carves a cut towards the third man boundary, off the toe end actually.
flat and quick around middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
good finish, just the one scoring shot off. Loopy outside off, Guptill strides forward and drives the ball back to the bowler
too full and wide, Latham caresses a gentle drive to the sweeper cover to open his account
135 kph, back of a length outside off, tapped to the left of backward point, which is why Guptill called 'yeaah' but Latham could not see that angle so he calls 'noo'
full and straight from Curran, pushed away towards mid-off, a solid punch
digs this in, a nice change in length, Guptill isn't taking a risk with NZ already three down, so he ducks underneath
drifts down leg this time, wide
good length, straight, 130 kph, pushed back towards the bowler.
another tidy end, back of a length on middle and off, not much Guptill can do but get behind the line and defend
the googly outside off, Latham taps the ball in front of cover, not to him, enabling an easy run. Nice use of the face of the bat
flatter and quicker down leg, nudged to midwicket
flatter, may have been the flipper. Guptill opens the bat face and guides it down towards third man
83 kph, flat and quick around off, Latham goes back and nudges the ball to midwicket
88 kph, the googly? Flat around off, defended back. Was the flipper
this one is tossed up, 84 kph, outside off, driven away towards cover
a half-volley to start, with drift. Full and very wide but Guptill nails his drive to cover
full and wide outside off, pushed away towards deep point
nice and full again, on middle and leg, driven to long-on. No spin yet
too full again, around middle, an easy punch down to long-on for a single
91 kph, flat around middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
nicely played, runs down towards the pitch and works the ball with his wrists, to deep midwicket. Another good single
a slow legbreak, 82 kph, around off. Latham is too early through his sweep, the ball hits him high on the pad
a full toss, a hit-me ball. Help yourself. Latham clips it away through backward square leg for four.
flat and quick around off, Latham defends
another poor ball but he gets away with it. A filthy long-hop on middle and leg, Latham backs away and pulls to the only person patrolling the square boundary on the leg side
88 kph, flight outside off, pushed away to long-off with the spin
some flight around off, 84 kph, Latham gets forward and blocks
overly full around off, 88 kph, another easy drive to long-on
shortish and quick, flat trajectory, punched to long-on
flat again, plenty of drift, guided to backward point
flight outside off, pushed away towards cover, 86 kph.
flight outside off, driven back to the bowler. Plenty of dots
ooh, short and wide, but Guptill picks out the only fielder there, backward point, with a fierce cut
back of a length outside off, climbs, Latham guides the ball with the open face towards backward point. Nicely on top of the bounce
a bouncer, on leg, Guptill gets on top of the bounce and nudges the ball to fine leg for a run
good length outside off, 128 kph, worked with the open face towards point
131 kph, a top edge, back of a length on middle and leg. Latham pulls but a thick leading edge falls just short of fine leg
back of a length down leg, 129 kph, off the thigh pad towards square leg. Guptill stays on 49, a leg bye
nicely bowled, 129 kph, on a length outside off, off the open face to point. Another dot
flight outside off, nudged to long-on. Gets to fifty does Guptill
nice use of the feet, chips down, and drives with the spin to long-off
shortish and wide outside off, carved away towards backward point
flight outside off, 88 kph, spins back in, worked to midwicket

uh oh. Guptill picks out deep midwicket. Another terrific play by England in the field. Roy makes it look so easy, that's one of the harder catches in international cricket. Some flight from Moeen, and Guptill accepts the invitation to sweep fiercely. He hasn't quite got it. There is plenty of bat behind the stroke, but not enough timing or elevation. The ball flies flat and low to Roy, who gets his hands in position early and takes a really good catch.
flight on middle and leg, blocked by Nicholls
back of a length, an open-faced dab to third man for one
short down leg, pulled away towards fine leg. Stokes may want to just go fuller to the new batsman
another glide off the open face to third man for a single

130 kph, another sensational catch! England are on fire. To be fair, that was a terrible delivery, short, wide and asking to be hit. Nicholls cuts, but doesn't keep the ball down. It flies flat and quick, like the Guptill catch, to Roy's right at backward point. His eyes are on the ball right through, he extends his hands with a reverse cup and takes it with both hands. Another very hard catch made to look incredibly easy. Stunning work from England this afternoon.
back of a length delivery outside off, the ball holds its line and beats the bat.
good length outside off, played away to point. End of another productive over for England
86 kph, flat on the pads, clipped away through square leg for a single
nicely stroked away, full and wide, driven to the sweeper cover.
flat and full, blocked
flat around off, Latham runs down and defends
quick around middle, punched away to long-on
quick outside off, defended from the back foot
129 kph, on a length outside off, inside-edged to the keeper as he looks for one to third man
short and wide outside off, chopped away to point
slightly short, around middle, pulled away to midwicket for a single. Hurried on the pull
beaten again! Maybe playing inside the line is de Grandhomme. A full delivery outside off, it angles it, still de Grandhomme is beaten on the outside edge
goes shorter, around middle and off, solidly behind the line
too short, 136 kph, back of a length around off, sits up on a slow pitch to swat through midwicket. Too easy.
flight on middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
lots of flight, and drift outside off, pushed away to deep square leg
89 kph, flat around middle, punched to long-on from the back foot
full and wide, driven away towards cover
quick again, outside off, driven to cover
overpitched outside off, pushed away to long-on for one.
full delivery outside off, driven to mid-off with the full face
nicely played, quite full and wide outside off, de Grandhomme leans into a drive through cover. Plenty of power behind the stroke, but pulled back just inside
another good single, full outside off, driven to mid-off for a single
enough on the pull to clear square leg. Back of a length on middle and leg, de Grandhomme chooses to pull, goes through with the stroke. Hitting with the wind and just clears the fielder
on the pads, 135 kph, de Grandhomme misses a flick, off the pad towards square leg
good length outside off, 123 kph, left alone
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
plenty of flight again, scythed away to deep point
some flight around middle, pushed to long-on
88 kph outside off, pushed to long-on
flat and wide outside off, 93 kph, punched to extra cover

another one falls. NZ tottering now. Short, back of a length and wide outside off, some extra bounce for Moeen, maybe some overspin. Latham looks to cut but doesn't account for that extra bounce, the ball takes the leading edge and lobs to short third man, diving in front of him.
the drag-down. Flat, quick, down leg, just helped along past short fine leg for four. Rashid's first delivery of the new spell
flat and wide outside off, punched to long-off
short and wide outside off, cut away to the sweeper cover for a single
the googly around middle and leg, 84 kph, nudged to midwicket. Picked by de Grandhomme
very full on leg, languidly driven to long-on for one
flat and straight, the legbreak, looking for a bat between bat and pad, but Santner's bat is solidly behind the line
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off for a single
flat and quick, 89 kph, pushed to cover
flight outside off, driven to long-off for one
there is Mo's drift! That's why slip is always a decent position for him, especially with this wind. Flat and quick outside off, drifts on. Takes the outside edge and flies through slip
overly full outside off, driven to cover from the crease
more drift, de Grandhomme is through the shot too early, pushed to cover
direct hit! Third umpire. A legbreak around off, pushed away towards mid-off. A direct hit at the bowler's end, but Santner is comfortably back.
some flight on middle and off, defended
nicely bowled, a legbreak around off, defended
quicker around off, hit back towards the bowler
quick again, the legbreak, full, smothered
82 kph, a tidy finish, flat around off, clipped away to midwicket
tossed up down leg, driven back to the bowler
flat and straight, another slider. Santner is behind the line again
quick down leg, off the pad towards short third man. Curran fires at the bowler's end, only to miss and concede an overthrow
flat down leg, nudged to midwicket. Hurrying through these overs
shortish and wide, carved to Roy at extra cover, nothing beating him today
89 kph, nicely tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
good length and slanted across off stump. Defended on the front foot through the covers
full and just outside off. Tapped to mid-off's left
slower ball at a length, just outside off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length on off stump. Sits up nicely and pulls on the front foot to get it over midwicket. Deep square sprints to his right and pulls it back in
back of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot

nicely timed. CDG stands tall in the crease and allows this length ball to come into him. Has the length sized up nicely and manages to get his wrists under it to lift it wide of mid-on with a pick-up shot
back of a length and in at leg stump. Tapped to long-on off the back foot
back of a length and pushed across off stump. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
length outside off, punched to cover
full outside off, driven to long-off
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
offcutter, good length on leg stump. Flicked through square leg from the crease
full on leg stump, worked with the soft hands to deep square's right to steal a second

full on leg stump again, same shot again. But this time Bairstow at deep square has fired a flat throw in after getting there marginally quicker. CDG is struggling. It's been sent upstairs. It's out. A yard short. England have been good, but it won't be unfair to question the wisdom of going back for the second this time. It was much more in front of square and towards the fielder in comparison to the last ball. A good innings from CDG ends tamely

400 strike rate via the outside edge. It flies wide of the slip fielder - would have been straight to third slip. Back of a length ball sits in the pitch with some nip away. Southee on his heels with the weight falling backwards and the bat following the line of the ball
yorker aimed at off stump. He digs it out
short and wide outside off, backs away and deliberately goes over point with the cut
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

well, what do I know. Southee's gone. Full and drifted in at leg stump. Santner flicks to Stokes' right at midwicket. He fumbles. Santner is waiting to make a call and has taken a few steps down. Southee, however, is craning his neck and is twisted awkwardly trying to look at the ball. When Santner does make the call to go for the run, Southee isn't in position to sprint. Santner makes it at the non-striker's end but Southee won't survive as Stokes fires it on the bounce to Buttler
back of a length on off stump, shuffles and flicks through square leg off the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
arm ball, back of a length and across off stump. Pushed to backward point off the thick edge
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
tossed up on off, met on the full and shovelled to deep square's right
back of a length, pushed flat on off stump. Makes room and punched to long-off
length on off stump, steps out and defends into the covers
slow, loopy length ball on leg stump. Dead-batted into the off side
good length and flat again, outside off. Defended on the back foot
good length and pushed across off stump. Left alone
oh shot. He has belted this through midwicket. Back of a length outside off from Curran but Santner has his eyes right on top of it as he unleashes a full swing on this
bouncer's too short. He leaves and takes the freebie
falls short of deep square leg. It's overpitched on leg stump and he loses control on the flick. Hit well but not well enough
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length and on the stumps. Whipped through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length slider, down leg side. Gets an inside edge on the attempted flick but Buttler can only parry that towards short fine
back of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, whipped straight to midwicket off the back foot
well placed. Plants the front leg forward to reach the pitch of this on middle stump and gets the sweep to the square leg boundary, bisecting two fielders there
short and in at leg stump. Hurriedly pulls to deep backward square
good length on middle stump. Defended on the back foot
short ball across the corridor. Nicely behind the line yet again as he hooks. Keeps it along the ground and gets it between deep square and fine leg
slower ball, good length on middle stump. Punched to long-on
short of a length just outside off, left alone
bouncer is too short again. No way to play it
short of a length outside off, stylishly cut through cover point
short ball, pulled with control to deep square
full and down leg side. Lockie looks to bring out the Natmeg without too much success, and gets runs fine with a deflection off the pad
short of a length and wide outside off. Can't beat Roy at point with the cut
short of a length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the back foot
good length just outside off, defended off the back foot
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Drilled straight to sweeper cover
outside edge and far too wide of third man to his right. Stokes short again. Santner slashes and can't middle it
slower ball dug short outside off. Pulled straight to midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the back foot
short ball on middle stump, pulled uppishly towards deep square leg
short and wide outside off, cut to third man off the thick outside edge
slower ball, full on off stump. Driven straight to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, chopped straight to point
short ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he hangs the bat out

Roy has missed a pick up and a possible run out. The first real missed chance. Santner taps this in front of point and it's a very tight run halfway through becase Roy has already reached the ball. He can't gather on the first attempt though
length outside off, beaten as he looks to jab at it
slower ball. On middle stump at a good length. Pushed to mid-on
clipped to deep square's right off the pads. Lockie puts in the slide at the non-striker's end and they steal the extra run

slapped away. England are happy to go short right now. Santner doesn't mind at all. It's an offcutter from Stokes, short and wide outside off. Sweeper cover won't come anywhere near this despite a sprint to his left
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
full toss on leg stump. Catches him flush on the thigh guard as he's late on the flick
short ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle, tickled to fine leg off the back foot. Another slower ball from Curran
full on leg stump, slight tail away. Hits across the angle to long-on and says no to the second
yorker on off stump, blocks it with the full face
short again. Just outside off. Slices to third man's left and says no as Willey picks it up and lines up for the throw
short of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square
back of a length outside off, backs away and punches on the up to extra cover
short and wide outside off, looks to cut but that's out of his reach
back of a length on off stump, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
back of a length on middle, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
gives him the charge and is forced to quickly duck under it. It's a well-directed bouncer
stays true to the sporting tradition of being a Fergie and leaves it late. It's a short ball but it's a slower one too. Stands tall, allows it to come on and wallops this over deep midwicket
offcutter, length on middle stump. Dabbed into the leg side with soft hands
he's getting good at this slogging thing! Slower ball on a good length, on a leg stump line. Gets the front leg out of the way and sends it sailing high over square leg

gorgeous! Santner's highest score in ODIs comes with a top class chip over the bowler to beat mid-off. Stays put in the crease and is very still as this full ball comes in at off stump. Extends the arms to find the boundary
high and off the toe-end but it clears extra cover who is pedalling backwards. This is overpitched and he's looking to go inside-out, but the connection isn't perfect
length and in at leg stump. Gets inside the line to try and tickle it fine. It dribbles to Buttler's left off the pad
yorker from around the wicket, in at leg stump. Squeezes it out to long-on

can't beat mid-off to his left. Rashid joins the party with a tumbling catch to his left. Not a particularly good ball from Stokes to a batsman who has exposed his stumps - bowls it on a good length and at middle stump. It's in the zone but he ends up slicing it to Rashid's left
back of a length outside off, jabs and he's beaten. Even the best need time to get their eye in
yep, he's got his eye in now. He gets a front foot press - not down the pitch, it's into the leg side. Swipes under this length ball outside off and clears extra cover. This is masterful

the perfect leave to follow it up. Nicely and intentionally inside the line at this length ball outside off. High elbow, full face of the bat. Allows the ball to go through to Buttler. Nice bloke that he is, he smiles at the bowler too
yorker and wide outside off. Nicely executed. Santner can't do more than jam this into the covers
it's in the slot, but it's a slower ball he hasn't picked. Through the slog early as this slides through from under the blade outside off
...and it's four next ball. Length just outside off. Stands tall and goes straight. Off the bottom part of the bat but he's got enough to clear mid-off

length on off stump, short-arm jab into the ground, to deep midwicket's right. A one-handed pick up and throw from Stokes. Boult appears to have slid his bat in on the second run...but third umpire's replay finds him an inch short. A cruel end to his innings. A premature one for New Zealand. Fourth run out of the innings
back of a length to begin, Roy checks his defensive prod.
full and wide outside off, the ball moving away. Roy lets that one go
a nice stop from the confident Santner at mid-off. Full and wide outside off, Roy strides forward and caresses a drive towards Santner, who dives to his right to stop the ball
strays down leg this time for a wide.
back of a length around off, punched back towards the bowler
excellently bowled, goes wide of the creases, it pitches outside off and seams away just a touch, enough angle to beat Roy's prod
drifts down leg for another wide
short and wide, Roy would normally thrash that through point but he is a bit circumspect early, so lets this one go
lovely start, full outside off, the ball holding it's line, Bairstow play for more swing than there is, the ball beats the  outside edge
full and wide, angled across, no stroke from Bairstow
back of a length, around off, 139 kph, right behind the line of that to defend
good length on off, just a hint of inward movement, not too much, worked into the leg side
that's in the slot and it's smashed for four. Overpitched and wide from Boult, Bairstow stands his ground, just leans into the stroke and caresses it through cover
angled across, a tad wider. Bairstow lets that one through
full, wide and smashed! It was moving away but in Roy's hitting arc, he smashes the ball over wide mid-off. Got underneath the length too
too straight this time, he goes wide of the crease, but strays on the pads, clipped neatly through square leg for four more.
good comeback, hits a tidy length on a fourth-stump channel, punched to cover
good length, fifth-stump area, but Roy has shuffled across, so it isn't there to cut, it's too close. Left alone
nicely bowled and well played, full around middle and leg, pushed away to mid-on with the high elbow
133 kph, good finish from Southee to that over, just fuller than a good length, wobbles around before beating Roy on the inside edge. Hits him on the back leg, there's an appeal but too high
angles it across again, on a length, defended to cover by Bairstow
nicely played, full and wide, Bairstow opens the bat face and guides this away to third man

taken by Santner at square leg. A short delivery around middle and off, Roy looks to keep the pull down, but eventually he can't. He picks out the fielder. Saw the length early, though early but just couldn't adjust his hands. He would have been in a better position if he looked to hit it over square leg, but just couldn't quite get on top of the bounce to keep the ball down.
dug in first up, 141 kph, Root gets underneath that
another short one, 138 kph, a bouncer. Another duck
full and wide outside off, caressed to cover from the crease
back of a length around off, 136 kph, nudged to midwicket
short and wide outside off, extra bounce, the ball bounces over the cut
too straight from Southee, on middle and leg. Bairstow goes flicking, right in the gap at midwicket for four. Just timing
full outside off, 136 kph, brings Bairstow forward but he isn't driving just yet
short and wide again, Bairstow cuts fine, past backward point's left for a couple. Boult had to run across to get the ball in his stronger hand
short and wide again, slashed behind point again and it races away. Boult runs across but can't quite get there.
nicely clipped but Root picks out square leg. Full and swinging back in, flicked away but finds the fielder
good length delivery outside off, chopped down to third man for a single
full and swinging in, zoning in on that lbw. But Bairstow's broad bat comes in between, punched to mid-on
141 kph, back of a length outside off, guided away to point
137 kph, around off, not much swing, pushed to mid-off
fine end, 136 kph, back of a length around off, Bairstow guides the ball to point from the crease. Terrific over
131 kph, good single. Full and wide, swinging away. Root slices the ball to the left of extra cover, calls yes, a fumble allows an easy run
too straight again, nudged away past square leg for a single.
133 kph, another nice bouncer, around middle and leg, pulled through square leg for a single. Ferguson gets across from fine leg to cut it off
a slower ball outside off, 117 kph, worked to midwicket
muscled through cover. Full and wide from Southee, Bairstow, it seemed, looked to hit that too hard. The timing isn't great but the placement is, past cover.
135 kph, lovely timing again. Full and swinging away, sliced past point for a run to third man

what a shot that is. 136 kph, a length delivery but Boult makes the error of bowling that too straight. A pick-up flick, a checked pick-up flick. Stunning timing, it clears the backward square leg boundary
back of a length delivery outside off, Bairstow fails to connect with an attempted upper cut
the natural response from the quick. A word too from Boult. The bouncer down leg, Bairstow ducks
a tad too straight, 137 kph, nudged down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, Root brings out the dab, plays it ever so late. Fine single, all the best players in the world play that shot.
136 kph, good length around off, clipped to square leg
some flight around off, pushed to mid-on.
a poor delivery from Santner. He drops short outside off, Root hurries back and pulls over midwicket with nonchalant ease. So easy
shortish and wide, carved away towards cover
86 kph, full around middle and leg, clipped towards de Grandhomme at midwicket, he gets across with a smart left hand
flat on middle and leg, swept towards short fine leg
89 kph, flat trajectory to protect the over, flat and wide, punched to cover
136 kph, good length delivery outside off, pushed into the off side. Stays on the back foot, trying to force it through
too close to cut, 136 kph, outside off, under-edged towards the keeper
lovely stop from Chapman at extra cover. Full and wide, in the Root driving arc. Drilled. Chapman dives away to his left
full and straight, 139 kph, driven back to the bowler

taken by de Grandhomme! Another catch for the series highlights reel! So good that catch was that Root first called 'yeah'. He had thought it passed de Grandhomme. On the pads from Boult, it's a scoring opportunity, at least that's what Root thinks. He fails to keep it down, the ball lobs to de Grandhomme's right. Both feet off the ground, one hand outstretched to his right, the ball meets palm and Root is gone. Some fine fielding today.
short, around middle, 138 kph, fended away. A wicket maiden
lots of flight outside off, Bairstow gets forward and drives to the sweeper cover.
tossed up outside off, Morgan gets forward to defend
flat outside off, cut down towards short third man
slightly shortish and wide, carved away towards backward point. Ferguson fumbles on the boundary, but Morgan doesn't want the risk
plenty of flight around off, drilled to cover
nicely bowled, slow around off, defended back
good length delivery on middle and off, pushed back
the top edge for four. Another nice bouncer down leg, hurrying Morgan through the pull. Takes the leading edge and flies over the keeper
fine placement. It races away for four. Overpitched outside off from Boult, Morgan strides forward and punches the drive through cover. All timing.
four more. All timing again. Full again, Morgan stays slightly leg side of the line. But that doesn't throw off his timing. Punched past the bowler, races away again.
shortish this time, back of a length and wide, flies past gully for a run to third man
a length delivery outside off, guided away to gully
nice and full down leg, pushed away to long-on for a run
very full outside off, driven away to long-off
a bunt for six. How easy was that from Morgan? Tossed up outside off, Morgan gets underneath the length and lofts the ball over mid-off. No sweat. Just bottom hand and timing. Batting these days ...
slower around off, defended
flat on off, looking to cut but it's too close, worked to midwicket
gets right forward to defend that
good length on off, decent pace, pushed back to the bowler
143 kph, good bounce and pace, back of a length outside off, carved away to third man
back of a length on a fourth-stump channel, 144 kph, punched to extra cover
short and wide, carved towards backward point, who dives to his left and parries it to extra cover to get the ball away. Another lovely piece of fielding
goes short does Ferguson, it isn't too short or too quick for Morgan though. Square leg is up so the pull goes over the fielder and clears the boundary too

143 kph. Dropped! Did we just see a catch go down? Another bouncer, another pull, but a completely different result. A thick top edge, Latham leaps to his left but can only get a hand on it. Not an easy catch, but he could have so easily parried it up for himself.
slow down leg, off the thigh pad for a run to short fine leg
flight outside off, drilled to deep cover
shortish down leg, clipped to midwicket
nice and slow, but too straight, nudged to square leg
flat and straight, clipped towards square leg, one more easy run
flat and quick, tidy over ends, punched back to the bowler
looking to bowl too quick, short down leg. Bairstow just helps that fine, through fine leg. Didn't go through with the shot lest he pick out fine leg

straight to third man! Another short delivery outside off, Bairstow looks to guide that over the slip cordon so he places his bat in a position to get the ball over or just past slip. But the ball hits more of the bat than Bairstow wanted. Takes a good chunk of the bat and carries down to third man.
back of a length outside off, 142 kph, nicely left alone
146 kph, full and straight, pushed away to mid-on
short again, quick again, left alone by Stokes. Giving himself a few sighters
looking for the yorker, around off, jammed away to cover
good length delivery outside off, a discernible change-down in pace, defended

120 kph, that was a weird run. Absolutely no need for that. Back of a length down leg, Morgan comes down and misses a flick. The ball trickles back up the pitch, Morgan thinks of going back but it was Stokes' call, so he goes through with the run. De Grandhomme runs in and kicks the ball past the post from a meter out.
on a length down leg, Stokes comes down and misses a glance. May have clipped the pad. There was an optimistic appeal
just wide of mid-on. 123 kph, back of a length around off, Stokes pulls, not great timing, but decent placement. Just past the fielder.
good length outside off, carved to point after a forward shimmy
123 kph, good length, hit away to long-on for a single.
short and slanted across off stump. Gets on top of the bounce and taps it to point
short of a length on middle stump, nudged through square leg and a loud call of no to prevent an unnecessary risk on the second. Santner was onto this quickly
shot. Morgan stays leg side of this and taps it through the covers. Not easy, because it's climbing at him. But that spring into the leg side allows him as he leaps off the ground and caresses this
short and angled across off. This time his technique means he can't get close enough to connect on the cut
outside edge to third man's right. Hangs his bat out as this is pushed across him
back of a length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
picks up the short ball on off stump and turns it to deep square with a pull
back of a length on middle stump, shovelled between deep square and fine leg who converge and slide. Bit of a tangle there and it allows two easy runs
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket
bouncer is dug in too short. He ducks
back of a length outside off, steps out and punches to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, pushed to point
crashed. Straight to sweeper cover. Width from CDG, back of a length and Morgan gets a smooth swing through the line
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
too short again. This time down leg side. Stokes doesn't have to do more than follow with his hands and tickle this fine. He does it with an angled bat
shot. Springs on the back foot and punches this through midwicket, across the angle
back of a length and in on off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on off stump. Pushes without feet. Gets it out to mid-on off the inside half. Bit of a gap there between bat and pad
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off on the up
short and just outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler on the bounce
good length and in at off stump. Tapped to extra cover on the up
'No! No! No!' is the assured call from Stokes. He's inside-edged a pull shot right onto his hip bone. There's no question of a run and he sends Morgan back. On his back but he's alright
good length outside off, gives him the charge and thumps this on the up. Finds mid-off on the bounce
good length on middle stump, plants the front leg forward and drives to long-on
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
full on leg stump, allows it on and tickles it past short fine. Easy peasy. It races to the boundary
good length on middle stump, driven to long-on
length outside off. Looks to drive through the off side against the turn. Not to the pitch of this. He gets a single at long leg
good length on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler with the turn

oh dear! This would've been a screamer from Nicholls! But he's lost the grip on it as he's headed for the turf. Gravity's ruined what could've been a stunning moment. Morgan nails the pull shot against this short ball at his ribs. It's going down and to Nicholls' left. He manages to get two hands on it while being air-borne. Whew
short at the ribs again, tucked to deep square along the floor
back of a length and in at the stumps. Defended off the back foot
gentle. Stokes eases this through the covers. It's back of a length and just outside off. All timing as he pierces extra cover, standing tall while doing it
no one's stopping this pull. Half-tracker at middle stump and he won't go gentle at this. Gets on the back foot quickly and hammers it on the up
back of a length on middle, tapped into the midwicket region
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, punches towards long-on but Guptill slides to his right to stop it. Looks in some discomfort with that shoulder, but he'll carry on
length on leg stump, pushed to long-on on the up
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
welcome back, Stokes. Steps out and strikes it so clean, straight over the bowler's head. Length on off stump and it's a clean swing to find the sightscreen
top edge lands safely in front of deep square. Checked the pull shot this time and was stuck in an awkward angle. Chapman ran in and had to stop, he wasn't getting there
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side

bounces over Chapman at deep square who has decided to run in this time. Once again, no chance of making it at deep square. But he commits to following it, the hook dips on him and it clears his head as he slides
back of a length on the stumps, defended on the back foot
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
short and pushed wide outside off. Under-edges the cut to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor. Doesn't climb up. He adjusts to keep the pull along the ground
short on the ribs, controlled hook to deep square
yorker tailing in late at leg stump. Jammed out to mid-on
brings up fifty with a cart over midwicket. The short-ball isn't working for Boult at the moment. Another one sits up to be pulled and he smacks it well in front of square
yorker on off stump, tapped on the full to mid-off
short ball outside off, sways away from it to leave
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-on with the full face
length and in at middle stump. Flicked to deep square's right from the crease
short and in the corridor. Cuts late to find backward point
back of a length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
full outside off, doesn't get the front foot close as he looks to drive. Ends up slicing it off the toe-end. Cover point gets a hand to it with a dive and saves three
back of a length on off stump, whipped straight to mid-on
good length and in at middle stump, pushed straight to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, tapped down the pitch
back of a length and in at leg stump. Can't get bat on the attempted flick
short of a length and into the body. Shovelled on the rise to midwicket
good length on leg stump, punched towards long-on
short ball outside off, pulled to long-on's left
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square

misjudged in the deep slightly as a difficult chance flies Chapman's way at sweeper cover. It's a short ball angled across Morgan who plays a delightful upper cut. Chapman runs in and has to track back to his right. In the end, he's leaping over the rope to try and get a hand to that. Might have come close if he was on the line, but it would've been a tough one to hang onto anyway
cramped in the corridor, gets it into the off side off the under-edge
short ball outside off, gets behind the line and slaughters with a horizontal bat, wide of mid-on
back of a length outside off, sliced uppishly towards point
length ball from wide of the crease. Pitches on leg and keeps going with the angle. Latham won't get that
length and angled in at middle stump. Nudged on the up to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, tapped back down the pitch

taken by Munro. A slo-mo, anti-climactic caught-and-bowled. Might have been the knuckle ball because this didn't come off after pitching. It's just outside off but with an angle in. He tries to cut but it ends up hitting the top part of the bat and lobs back to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, controlled nudge to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump. Clipped off the thigh, can't beat midwicket to his left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right. He'll only get one, but he's got 49 before. First fifty on international return
bouncer at the ribs. Watchfully defended into the leg side
bouncer just outside off, he looks to defend but he's caught off guard. This fizzes past the outside edge
back of a length outside off, solidly defended on the rise
hooks. Top edge. Six. Simple solution against a short-ball strategy. This is speedy, short and wide outside off. He's in woeful position for the hook but he gets the runs over slip
full on off stump, driven back towards the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length and in at leg stump. Dabbed to deep square's right with soft hands
back of a length outside off, nudged through square leg
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
length on the pads, flicked to deep square
inside edge as he's rooted in the crease while looking to drive. It's full and wide outside off. Single through square leg
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
short outside off, pulled to deep square
length and angled in at off stump. Another inside edge, this time as he looks to defend
back of a length on middle and leg, punched away to long-on from the back foot.
111 kph, a slower ball down leg, easy pickings for Buttler, nudged to square leg for one
overpitched on middle and leg, hit back to Munro from the crease
slow, 100 kph, and straight and full. A solid defensive block
gives himself room but Munro doesn't change his mode of operation. Slow and straight, driven to cover
108 kph, length around off, pushed to long-on
full and wide from Southee, 128 kph, a thick outside edge races down to third man
full outside off, Buttler gets right across and nudges the ball into the gap at backward square leg for a couple.
good length outside off, head over the ball as Buttler defends
oh he's found the gap. Shuffles across, Southee digs this in, short outside off. He swivels on a pull and finds the gap behind square, between fine leg and square leg.

that's a NZD 50,000 catch! The catching continues to be mighty impressive today. A bouncer around off, Buttler top-edges the pull and clears fine leg. The man, in the brown-clad shirt, takes a lovely, well-judged reverse-cupped catch
crashed for four. That's magnificent power. Short again, Buttler nails this behind square again. Flat and fast, no chance
good length outside off, swatted to mid-off
worked away towards short fine leg
full and wide outside, Stokes backs away and nails a cover drive to the right of cover. Sublime timing
on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
good length down leg, punched away to long-on from the crease
99 kph, a slower ball outside off, driven away to cover.
lots of flight on leg, driven to mid-on, who is on the edge of the circle. The fielder is on the edge to elicit a big hit from Stokes.
flat down leg, Buttler misses a flick, may have clipped the thigh pad to Latham
79 kph, shortish on leg, worked away to square leg
full down leg, another nudge through square leg. Stokes does not want to get out
that's the game! England level the series. Santner drops short, around off, Buttler rocks back and pulls, deposits the ball into the grass banks over midwicket.
